bug.author: hkvision
bug.description:
I run pytorch/train/mnist/main.py on YARN Almaren cluster and get the following error: <denchmark-code>[Stage 1:> (0 + 2) / 2]2020-08-10 18:43:28 ERROR TaskSetManager:70 - Task 1 in stage 1.0 failed 1 times; aborting job Traceback (most recent call last): File "main.py", line 124, in <module> main() File "main.py", line 113, in main train_featureset = FeatureSet.pytorch_dataloader(train_loader) File "/opt/work/client/anaconda3/envs/standalone/lib/python3.6/site-packages/zoo/feature/common.py", line 383, in pytorch_dataloader jvalue = callZooFunc(bigdl_type, "createFeatureSetFromPyTorch", bys) File "/opt/work/client/anaconda3/envs/standalone/lib/python3.6/site-packages/zoo/common/utils.py", line 133, in callZooFunc raise e File "/opt/work/client/anaconda3/envs/standalone/lib/python3.6/site-packages/zoo/common/utils.py", line 127, in callZooFunc java_result = api(*args) File "/opt/work/client/anaconda3/envs/standalone/lib/python3.6/site-packages/py4j/java_gateway.py", line 1257, in __call__ answer, self.gateway_client, self.target_id, self.name) File "/opt/work/client/anaconda3/envs/standalone/lib/python3.6/site-packages/py4j/protocol.py", line 328, in get_return_value format(target_id, ".", name), value) py4j.protocol.Py4JJavaError: An error occurred while calling o67.createFeatureSetFromPyTorch. : org.apache.spark.SparkException: Job aborted due to stage failure: Task 1 in stage 1.0 failed 1 times, most recent failure: Lost task 1.0 in stage 1.0 (TID 3, Almaren-Node-058, executor 2): jep.JepException: jep.JepException: <class 'zipimport.ZipImportError'>: can't decompress data; zlib not available at com.intel.analytics.zoo.common.PythonInterpreter$.threadExecute(PythonInterpreter.scala:87) at com.intel.analytics.zoo.common.PythonInterpreter$.exec(PythonInterpreter.scala:96) at com.intel.analytics.zoo.feature.PythonFeatureSet$$anonfun$loadPythonSet$1.apply(FeatureSet.scala:358) at com.intel.analytics.zoo.feature.PythonFeatureSet$$anonfun$loadPythonSet$1.apply(FeatureSet.scala:354) at org.apache.spark.rdd.RDD$$anonfun$mapPartitions$1$$anonfun$apply$23.apply(RDD.scala:801) at org.apache.spark.rdd.RDD$$anonfun$mapPartitions$1$$anonfun$apply$23.apply(RDD.scala:801) at org.apache.spark.rdd.MapPartitionsRDD.compute(MapPartitionsRDD.scala:52) at org.apache.spark.rdd.RDD.computeOrReadCheckpoint(RDD.scala:324) at org.apache.spark.rdd.RDD.iterator(RDD.scala:288) at org.apache.spark.scheduler.ResultTask.runTask(ResultTask.scala:90) at org.apache.spark.scheduler.Task.run(Task.scala:121) at org.apache.spark.executor.Executor$TaskRunner$$anonfun$10.apply(Executor.scala:408) at org.apache.spark.util.Utils$.tryWithSafeFinally(Utils.scala:1360) at org.apache.spark.executor.Executor$TaskRunner.run(Executor.scala:414) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745) Caused by: jep.JepException: <class 'zipimport.ZipImportError'>: can't decompress data; zlib not available at <string>.<module>(<string>:2) at jep.Jep.exec(Native Method) at jep.Jep.exec(Jep.java:478) at com.intel.analytics.zoo.common.PythonInterpreter$$anonfun$1.apply$mcV$sp(PythonInterpreter.scala:94) at com.intel.analytics.zoo.common.PythonInterpreter$$anonfun$1.apply(PythonInterpreter.scala:93) at com.intel.analytics.zoo.common.PythonInterpreter$$anonfun$1.apply(PythonInterpreter.scala:93) at scala.concurrent.impl.Future$PromiseCompletingRunnable.liftedTree1$1(Future.scala:24) at scala.concurrent.impl.Future$PromiseCompletingRunnable.run(Future.scala:24) at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511) at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266) ... 3 more
Driver stacktrace: at org.apache.spark.scheduler.DAGScheduler.org$apache$spark$scheduler$DAGScheduler$$failJobAndIndependentStages(DAGScheduler.scala:1889) at org.apache.spark.scheduler.DAGScheduler$$anonfun$abortStage$1.apply(DAGScheduler.scala:1877) at org.apache.spark.scheduler.DAGScheduler$$anonfun$abortStage$1.apply(DAGScheduler.scala:1876) at scala.collection.mutable.ResizableArray$class.foreach(ResizableArray.scala:59) at scala.collection.mutable.ArrayBuffer.foreach(ArrayBuffer.scala:48) at org.apache.spark.scheduler.DAGScheduler.abortStage(DAGScheduler.scala:1876) at org.apache.spark.scheduler.DAGScheduler$$anonfun$handleTaskSetFailed$1.apply(DAGScheduler.scala:926) at org.apache.spark.scheduler.DAGScheduler$$anonfun$handleTaskSetFailed$1.apply(DAGScheduler.scala:926) at scala.Option.foreach(Option.scala:257) at org.apache.spark.scheduler.DAGScheduler.handleTaskSetFailed(DAGScheduler.scala:926) at org.apache.spark.scheduler.DAGSchedulerEventProcessLoop.doOnReceive(DAGScheduler.scala:2110) at org.apache.spark.scheduler.DAGSchedulerEventProcessLoop.onReceive(DAGScheduler.scala:2059) at org.apache.spark.scheduler.DAGSchedulerEventProcessLoop.onReceive(DAGScheduler.scala:2048) at org.apache.spark.util.EventLoop$$anon$1.run(EventLoop.scala:49) at org.apache.spark.scheduler.DAGScheduler.runJob(DAGScheduler.scala:737) at org.apache.spark.SparkContext.runJob(SparkContext.scala:2061) at org.apache.spark.SparkContext.runJob(SparkContext.scala:2082) at org.apache.spark.SparkContext.runJob(SparkContext.scala:2101) at org.apache.spark.SparkContext.runJob(SparkContext.scala:2126) at org.apache.spark.rdd.RDD.count(RDD.scala:1168) at com.intel.analytics.zoo.feature.PythonFeatureSet$.loadPythonSet(FeatureSet.scala:366) at com.intel.analytics.zoo.feature.PythonFeatureSet.<init>(FeatureSet.scala:428) at com.intel.analytics.zoo.feature.FeatureSet$.python(FeatureSet.scala:648) at com.intel.analytics.zoo.feature.python.PythonFeatureSet.createFeatureSetFromPyTorch(PythonFeatureSet.scala:189) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62) at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:497) at py4j.reflection.MethodInvoker.invoke(MethodInvoker.java:244) at py4j.reflection.ReflectionEngine.invoke(ReflectionEngine.java:357) at py4j.Gateway.invoke(Gateway.java:282) at py4j.commands.AbstractCommand.invokeMethod(AbstractCommand.java:132) at py4j.commands.CallCommand.execute(CallCommand.java:79) at py4j.GatewayConnection.run(GatewayConnection.java:238) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745) Caused by: jep.JepException: jep.JepException: <class 'zipimport.ZipImportError'>: can't decompress data; zlib not available at com.intel.analytics.zoo.common.PythonInterpreter$.threadExecute(PythonInterpreter.scala:87) at com.intel.analytics.zoo.common.PythonInterpreter$.exec(PythonInterpreter.scala:96) at com.intel.analytics.zoo.feature.PythonFeatureSet$$anonfun$loadPythonSet$1.apply(FeatureSet.scala:358) at com.intel.analytics.zoo.feature.PythonFeatureSet$$anonfun$loadPythonSet$1.apply(FeatureSet.scala:354) at org.apache.spark.rdd.RDD$$anonfun$mapPartitions$1$$anonfun$apply$23.apply(RDD.scala:801) at org.apache.spark.rdd.RDD$$anonfun$mapPartitions$1$$anonfun$apply$23.apply(RDD.scala:801) at org.apache.spark.rdd.MapPartitionsRDD.compute(MapPartitionsRDD.scala:52) at org.apache.spark.rdd.RDD.computeOrReadCheckpoint(RDD.scala:324) at org.apache.spark.rdd.RDD.iterator(RDD.scala:288) at org.apache.spark.scheduler.ResultTask.runTask(ResultTask.scala:90) at org.apache.spark.scheduler.Task.run(Task.scala:121) at org.apache.spark.executor.Executor$TaskRunner$$anonfun$10.apply(Executor.scala:408) at org.apache.spark.util.Utils$.tryWithSafeFinally(Utils.scala:1360) at org.apache.spark.executor.Executor$TaskRunner.run(Executor.scala:414) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617) ... 1 more Caused by: jep.JepException: <class 'zipimport.ZipImportError'>: can't decompress data; zlib not available at <string>.<module>(<string>:2) at jep.Jep.exec(Native Method) at jep.Jep.exec(Jep.java:478) at com.intel.analytics.zoo.common.PythonInterpreter$$anonfun$1.apply$mcV$sp(PythonInterpreter.scala:94) at com.intel.analytics.zoo.common.PythonInterpreter$$anonfun$1.apply(PythonInterpreter.scala:93) at com.intel.analytics.zoo.common.PythonInterpreter$$anonfun$1.apply(PythonInterpreter.scala:93) at scala.concurrent.impl.Future$PromiseCompletingRunnable.liftedTree1$1(Future.scala:24) at scala.concurrent.impl.Future$PromiseCompletingRunnable.run(Future.scala:24) at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511) at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266) ... 3 more </denchmark-code>
Am I doing anything wrong or it is related to executor no zlib?

comments.comment:
I used Python 3.7 running <denchmark-link:https://github.com/intel-analytics/analytics-zoo/blob/master/pyzoo/zoo/examples/orca/learn/bigdl/pytorch/mnist/lenet_mnist.py>https://github.com/intel-analytics/analytics-zoo/blob/master/pyzoo/zoo/examples/orca/learn/bigdl/pytorch/mnist/lenet_mnist.py</denchmark-link> but still got this error: <denchmark-code>Traceback (most recent call last): File "pytorch_lenet_mnist.py", line 113, in <module> main() File "pytorch_lenet_mnist.py", line 107, in main validation_methods=[Accuracy()], checkpoint_trigger=EveryEpoch()) File "/opt/work/client/anaconda3/envs/orca-kai/lib/python3.7/site-packages/zoo/orca/learn/pytorch/estimator.py", line 209, in fit train_feature_set = FeatureSet.pytorch_dataloader(data, "", "") File "/opt/work/client/anaconda3/envs/orca-kai/lib/python3.7/site-packages/zoo/feature/common.py", line 389, in pytorch_dataloader False, features, labels) File "/opt/work/client/anaconda3/envs/orca-kai/lib/python3.7/site-packages/zoo/common/utils.py", line 133, in callZooFunc raise e File "/opt/work/client/anaconda3/envs/orca-kai/lib/python3.7/site-packages/zoo/common/utils.py", line 127, in callZooFunc java_result = api(*args) File "/opt/work/client/anaconda3/envs/orca-kai/lib/python3.7/site-packages/py4j/java_gateway.py", line 1257, in __call__ answer, self.gateway_client, self.target_id, self.name) File "/opt/work/client/anaconda3/envs/orca-kai/lib/python3.7/site-packages/py4j/protocol.py", line 328, in get_return_value format(target_id, ".", name), value) py4j.protocol.Py4JJavaError: An error occurred while calling o67.createFeatureSetFromPyTorch. : org.apache.spark.SparkException: Job aborted due to stage failure: Task 1 in stage 3.0 failed 1 times, most recent failure: Lost task 1.0 in stage 3.0 (TID 19, Almaren-Node-056, executor 1): jep.JepException: jep.JepException: <class 'zipimport.ZipImportError'>: can't decompress data; zlib not available at com.intel.analytics.zoo.common.PythonInterpreter$.threadExecute(PythonInterpreter.scala:87) at com.intel.analytics.zoo.common.PythonInterpreter$.exec(PythonInterpreter.scala:96) at com.intel.analytics.zoo.feature.PythonFeatureSet$$anonfun$loadPythonSet$1.apply(FeatureSet.scala:358) at com.intel.analytics.zoo.feature.PythonFeatureSet$$anonfun$loadPythonSet$1.apply(FeatureSet.scala:354) at org.apache.spark.rdd.RDD$$anonfun$mapPartitions$1$$anonfun$apply$23.apply(RDD.scala:801) at org.apache.spark.rdd.RDD$$anonfun$mapPartitions$1$$anonfun$apply$23.apply(RDD.scala:801) </denchmark-code>
Please take a look.

When I run in local, got the following error: <denchmark-code>Caused by: jep.JepException: <class 'ImportError'>: /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6: version `GLIBCXX_3.4.21' not found (required by /opt/work/client/anaconda3/envs/orca-kai/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/lib/libshm.so) at /opt/work/client/anaconda3/envs/orca-kai/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/__init__.<module>(__init__.py:136) at <string>.<module>(<string>:6) at jep.Jep.exec(Native Method) at jep.Jep.exec(Jep.java:478) at com.intel.analytics.zoo.common.PythonInterpreter$$anonfun$1.apply$mcV$sp(PythonInterpreter.scala:94) at com.intel.analytics.zoo.common.PythonInterpreter$$anonfun$1.apply(PythonInterpreter.scala:93) at com.intel.analytics.zoo.common.PythonInterpreter$$anonfun$1.apply(PythonInterpreter.scala:93) at scala.concurrent.impl.Future$PromiseCompletingRunnable.liftedTree1$1(Future.scala:24) at scala.concurrent.impl.Future$PromiseCompletingRunnable.run(Future.scala:24) at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511) at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266) ... 3 more </denchmark-code>
local error can't be reproduced. probably is my environment issue. Will confirm it later. YARN error can be reproduced by <denchmark-link:https://github.com/qiuxin2012>@qiuxin2012</denchmark-link>

When I run in local, got the following error: Caused by: jep.JepException: <class 'ImportError'>: /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6: version `GLIBCXX_3.4.21' not found (required by /opt/work/client/anaconda3/envs/orca-kai/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/lib/libshm.so) at /opt/work/client/anaconda3/envs/orca-kai/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/__init__.<module>(__init__.py:136) at <string>.<module>(<string>:6) at jep.Jep.exec(Native Method) at jep.Jep.exec(Jep.java:478) at com.intel.analytics.zoo.common.PythonInterpreter$$anonfun$1.apply$mcV$sp(PythonInterpreter.scala:94) at com.intel.analytics.zoo.common.PythonInterpreter$$anonfun$1.apply(PythonInterpreter.scala:93) at com.intel.analytics.zoo.common.PythonInterpreter$$anonfun$1.apply(PythonInterpreter.scala:93) at scala.concurrent.impl.Future$PromiseCompletingRunnable.liftedTree1$1(Future.scala:24) at scala.concurrent.impl.Future$PromiseCompletingRunnable.run(Future.scala:24) at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511) at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266) ... 3 more
Seems something wrong in your torch.

I used Python 3.7 running https://github.com/intel-analytics/analytics-zoo/blob/master/pyzoo/zoo/examples/orca/learn/bigdl/pytorch/mnist/lenet_mnist.py but still got this error: Traceback (most recent call last): File "pytorch_lenet_mnist.py", line 113, in <module> main() File "pytorch_lenet_mnist.py", line 107, in main validation_methods=[Accuracy()], checkpoint_trigger=EveryEpoch()) File "/opt/work/client/anaconda3/envs/orca-kai/lib/python3.7/site-packages/zoo/orca/learn/pytorch/estimator.py", line 209, in fit train_feature_set = FeatureSet.pytorch_dataloader(data, "", "") File "/opt/work/client/anaconda3/envs/orca-kai/lib/python3.7/site-packages/zoo/feature/common.py", line 389, in pytorch_dataloader False, features, labels) File "/opt/work/client/anaconda3/envs/orca-kai/lib/python3.7/site-packages/zoo/common/utils.py", line 133, in callZooFunc raise e File "/opt/work/client/anaconda3/envs/orca-kai/lib/python3.7/site-packages/zoo/common/utils.py", line 127, in callZooFunc java_result = api(*args) File "/opt/work/client/anaconda3/envs/orca-kai/lib/python3.7/site-packages/py4j/java_gateway.py", line 1257, in __call__ answer, self.gateway_client, self.target_id, self.name) File "/opt/work/client/anaconda3/envs/orca-kai/lib/python3.7/site-packages/py4j/protocol.py", line 328, in get_return_value format(target_id, ".", name), value) py4j.protocol.Py4JJavaError: An error occurred while calling o67.createFeatureSetFromPyTorch. : org.apache.spark.SparkException: Job aborted due to stage failure: Task 1 in stage 3.0 failed 1 times, most recent failure: Lost task 1.0 in stage 3.0 (TID 19, Almaren-Node-056, executor 1): jep.JepException: jep.JepException: <class 'zipimport.ZipImportError'>: can't decompress data; zlib not available at com.intel.analytics.zoo.common.PythonInterpreter$.threadExecute(PythonInterpreter.scala:87) at com.intel.analytics.zoo.common.PythonInterpreter$.exec(PythonInterpreter.scala:96) at com.intel.analytics.zoo.feature.PythonFeatureSet$$anonfun$loadPythonSet$1.apply(FeatureSet.scala:358) at com.intel.analytics.zoo.feature.PythonFeatureSet$$anonfun$loadPythonSet$1.apply(FeatureSet.scala:354) at org.apache.spark.rdd.RDD$$anonfun$mapPartitions$1$$anonfun$apply$23.apply(RDD.scala:801) at org.apache.spark.rdd.RDD$$anonfun$mapPartitions$1$$anonfun$apply$23.apply(RDD.scala:801)
Please take a look.
Based on my previous experience on Centos7.5, you should install zlib on your yarn nodemanager and update python to 3.7. <denchmark-link:https://unix.stackexchange.com/questions/291737/zipimport-zipimporterror-cant-decompress-data-zlib-not-available/334103>https://unix.stackexchange.com/questions/291737/zipimport-zipimporterror-cant-decompress-data-zlib-not-available/334103</denchmark-link>
